Also strongly agree clarification on what is or isn’t NSFW would be nice.

body: Customization of what shows up in hot for guilds you follow. When you follow a bunch of niche guilds that get maybe three posts a day at max, one general/popular guild can bury all the niche content. I'd like it if I could set it so posts from +general only show up for me if they pass a floor of rep that I personally set, say 100, while something from +gaming would show up regardless of rep.
body_html: Customization of what shows up in hot for guilds you follow. post.title: What is a feature you want to add to ruqqus?

body:
not in any particular order

1. When browsing guilds and you click on picture, right or down arrow keys to go to pic from next post and left/up keys to go back
2. Ability to expand picture thumbnail like reddit and voat do. this is better than above bc it allows addons/user scripts to auto-expand all pics if user wants
3. When someone posts a link to imgur/tumblr, parse thing and make it into a direct link as the default action. maybe give them an option to override but fucking at least try to fix the low-hanging fruit in the "use direct links" department by making it default for picture hosting sites. likewise, if the post is to reddit, fine let them link it but parse the page and set thumbnail to the linked image. many of us would prefer not to have to navigate to reddit/tumbler/imgur to view a single image and then hit back in browser again
body_html:
not in any particular order

  1. When browsing guilds and you click on picture, right or down arrow keys to go to pic from next post and left/up keys to go back
  2. Ability to expand picture thumbnail like reddit and voat do. this is better than above bc it allows addons/user scripts to auto-expand all pics if user wants
  3. When someone posts a link to imgur/tumblr, parse thing and make it into a direct link as the default action. maybe give them an option to override but fucking at least try to fix the low-hanging fruit in the "use direct links" department by making it default for picture hosting sites. likewise, if the post is to reddit, fine let them link it but parse the page and set thumbnail to the linked image. many of us would prefer not to have to navigate to reddit/tumbler/imgur to view a single image and then hit back in browser again
